389: Company Description CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers. Job Description The Opportunity: The Ecommerce Buyer / Merchandising Specialist will support Mattel’s Direct-to-Consumer Buying + Planning team in identifying, sourcing and purchasing quality products for our DTC websites. This position will help plan, develop, and execute product plans to achieve internal sales goals and support broader brand marketing efforts via compelling collections of product. The role will actively collaborate with cross-functional partners in Merchandising, Marketing, Franchise, Consumer Products, Brand, Product Development, Legal, etc. to ensure the best catalog and site experience possible. This creative individual should have experience with licensing, brand management and vertically integrated retail. What Your Impact Will Be: Develop and manage a robust pipeline of consumer products across multiple categories including: fashion, accessories, houseware, toys, home & office, etc. Define and maintain product inventory levels, track sales and determine product discontinuance timeline Collaborate with procurement and logistics to secure new vendors, process purchase orders and liaise with quality assurance and customer service Collaborate with brand, franchise and consumer products teams to identify relevant brands, artists, designers distributors, licensees, and personalities for the Mattel catalog Leverage professional network and acumen to build a culturally diverse roster of brand partners, collaborations, and product initiatives Work in tandem with the Merchandising group to track and coordinate sale of product, marketing assets, and cross-promotional synergies with partners Provide insights to optimize selling through various channels (social commerce, marketplace, DTC, live streaming, etc.) Work in tandem with the broader DTC Buying + Planning team to analyze sales demand and current trends to anticipate future product needs and devise a merchandise plan Use sales and site analytics to understand and improve sales performance, and gather consumer insights and feedback to adjust and improve future offerings Help define and manage new Print-on-Demand partners and Dropship initiatives Qualifications What We’re Looking For: Demonstrated a growth mindset by staying curious and continuously learning, embracing challenges, and improving themselves. 5+ years of experience in product merchandising role within eCommerce at a reputable brand Experience in line planning, price point setting, and product life cycle management Robust contacts and network of stakeholders across the licensing landscape Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and merchandising systems Robust knowledge of the eCommerce landscape and value chain from ideation around IP through to delivery and consumer experience Ability to work with and innovate with new brands Strong collaboration, communication, and planning skills Passion for products, curation, and storytelling Experience with site usability and optimization Strong analytical skills Knowledge of popular eCommerce platforms is a plus Global experience is a plus The annual base salary range for this position is between $85,600 and $129,000 **This range is indicative of projected hiring range, however annual base salary will be determined based on a candidate’s work location, skills and experience. What It’s Like to Work Here: We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors: We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower. We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking. We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results. Our Approach to Flexible Work: We embrace a flexible work model designed to empower a culture of growth, optimism, and wellbeing, where every employee can reach their full potential. Combining purposeful in-person collaboration with flexibility, our focus is to optimize performance and drive connection for moments that matter. Who We Are: Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. Mattel is recognized for the second year in a row as a Great Place to Work™ and as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators in 2022. Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers. Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.
